articles.headline: The Ukraine War’s Economic Toll Is Testing the West’s Unity Against Russia
articles.snippet: Russia’s president is calculating that Western leaders will tire before he does of a protracted struggle in Ukraine, especially if the price is turbocharged inflation and energy shortages.
articles.abstract: Russia’s president is calculating that Western leaders will tire before he does of a protracted struggle in Ukraine, especially if the price is turbocharged inflation and energy shortages.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The West united against Russia’s war on Ukraine more swiftly and solidly than almost anyone had expected. But as the war settles into a prolonged conflict, one that could rumble on for months or even years, it is testing the resolve of Western countries, with European and American officials questioning whether the rising economic toll will erode their solidarity over time.

articles.headline: Bitcoin Is Increasingly Acting Like Just Another Tech Stock
articles.snippet: The cryptocurrency’s plunging value has mirrored losses in the Nasdaq, a benchmark that’s weighted toward tech stocks.
articles.abstract: The cryptocurrency’s plunging value has mirrored losses in the Nasdaq, a benchmark that’s weighted toward tech stocks.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Bitcoin was conceived more than a decade ago as “digital gold,” a long-term store of value that would resist broader economic trends and provide a hedge against inflation.

articles.headline: In the Trenches of Eastern Ukraine, Combat Becomes a Vicious Dance
articles.snippet: In some villages along the front, Ukrainian and Russian soldiers face off at close quarters, sometimes within eyesight of one another.
articles.abstract: In some villages along the front, Ukrainian and Russian soldiers face off at close quarters, sometimes within eyesight of one another.
articles.byline: By Michael Schwirtz and Lynsey Addario

articles.headline: Major Donation to U.K. Conservative Party Was Flagged Over Russia Concerns
articles.snippet: The cash was part of a fund-raising blitz that helped propel Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s party to victory in 2019. Records track $630,225 to a Russian bank account.
articles.abstract: The cash was part of a fund-raising blitz that helped propel Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s party to victory in 2019. Records track $630,225 to a Russian bank account.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — One of the biggest donors to Britain’s Conservative Party is suspected of secretly funneling hundreds of thousands of dollars to the party from a Russian account, according to a bank alert filed to Britain’s national law enforcement agency.

articles.headline: Mary Barra’s ‘Long Game’: Winning the E.V. Race
articles.snippet: The General Motors chief says efficiencies, innovations and learning from mistakes will allow her company to become a leader in electric vehicles.
articles.abstract: The General Motors chief says efficiencies, innovations and learning from mistakes will allow her company to become a leader in electric vehicles.
articles.lead_paragraph: WARREN, Mich. — General Motors made a splash last year when it announced a bold plan to ramp up sales of electric vehicles and said it would stop making gasoline-powered vehicles by 2035.

articles.headline: A Union Blitzed Starbucks. At Amazon, It’s a Slog.
articles.snippet: Why has the union campaign spread so much further at the coffee chain than at the e-commerce giant?
articles.abstract: Why has the union campaign spread so much further at the coffee chain than at the e-commerce giant?
articles.lead_paragraph: Roughly six weeks after successful union votes at two Buffalo-area Starbucks stores in December, workers had filed paperwork to hold union elections in at least 20 other Starbucks locations nationwide.

articles.headline: How Two Middle School ‘Desperadoes’ Ended Up in a Police Shootout
articles.snippet: A 14-year-old girl and a 12-year-old boy took up weapons after a torturous journey through Florida’s juvenile mental health system.
articles.abstract: A 14-year-old girl and a 12-year-old boy took up weapons after a torturous journey through Florida’s juvenile mental health system.
articles.lead_paragraph: ENTERPRISE, Fla. — It was getting dark, so sheriff’s deputies used the lights on their rifles to get a better look at the two children who had been holed up in a suburban house for more than an hour.
